messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Buzzing About Unschooling
messages.msgSnippet: We maintain a couple of acres as flowering meadow, with water in the middle of each plot, especially south of the orchard.  Think 150 foot squares, separated
messages.messageBody:
We maintain a couple of acres as flowering meadow, with water in
the middle of each plot, especially south of the orchard. Think
150 foot squares, separated by 10 foot mowed paths, with a wading
pool in each. We overseeded with extra clover a few years back,
but mainly let what is, be. We also keep an acre in
blackberries, which is great fun.


----- Original Message -----
From: "Betsy" <ecsamhill@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, April 15, 2003 9:16 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Buzzing About Unschooling


|
|
| **plot together where the honey
| bees MUST live, from the flight path (we have them back this
year
| HURRAH - for 3 years we had to rely on bumbles for
pollination),
| and feed you all the free range eggs and organically raised
| produce you can eat.**
|
| Do you plant any particular flowering plants to attract your
honeybees?
|
| Betsy

messages.msgSnippet: **plot together where the honey bees MUST live, from the flight path (we have them back this year HURRAH - for 3 years we had to rely on bumbles for
messages.messageBody:
**plot together where the honey
bees MUST live, from the flight path (we have them back this year
HURRAH - for 3 years we had to rely on bumbles for pollination),
and feed you all the free range eggs and organically raised
produce you can eat.**

Do you plant any particular flowering plants to attract your honeybees?

Betsy
